intro: Erigeron rufescens, commonly known as pale coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and prairies, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, with the outer petals being pale blue to white. Erigeron rufescens is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
